episodes.content: South Hokkaido Railway is home to a popular tourist train. A third sector company, South Hokkaido Railway began operation in 2016 with the opening of the Hokkaido Shinkansen. With limited resources, the railway asked a major tour company to help develop and operate a tourist train. See how the company worked with the community, and used their know-how to turn a "regular" train into a fun tourist train that has been gaining attention across Japan.
episodes.description: South Hokkaido Railway is home to a tourist train that has been gaining attention across Japan. See how a tour company used their know-how to develop this popular and entertaining tourist train.
episodes.subtitle: South Hokkaido Railway: A Tourist Train Developed by a Tour Company
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: Chizu Express is a third sector local railway, which runs 56.1km through the Chugoku Mountains between Tottori and Hyogo Prefectures. From the beginning, the railway was constructed for high-speed operation. While many third sector railway companies are struggling to make a profit, Chizu Express has been in the black for 21 consecutive years. See how the company is able to run through the mountains at 130km/h with their pendulum type express trains, as well as the company's strategies to increase ridership on their local trains. In "Trains in Focus," hop on JR West's "Ametsuchi" tourist train that runs between Tottori and Izumoshi Stations.
episodes.description: Chizu Express, which runs through the Chugoku Mountains, has recorded a profit for 21 consecutive years. See how the company has managed to stay on top and what they are doing to ensure their future.
episodes.subtitle: Chizu Express: A Top Tier Third Sector Railway
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: Hitachinaka Seaside Railway in Ibaraki Prefecture opened in 2008. When it began operation, the 14.3km railway had a ridership of less than 700,000. Now, ridership exceeds 1 million annually. Making a profit in 2017, the company now plans to extend the line by 3.1km. See how the company is working with locals to increase ridership even further, and how the company's president is putting passengers first.
episodes.description: Since it opened, Hitachinaka Seaside Railway in Ibaraki Prefecture has seen an increase in ridership. See how this passenger focused railway is working with locals to increase ridership even further.
episodes.subtitle: Hitachinaka Seaside Railway: Pulling Together with the Local Community
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: "Ekinaka" refers to the shops and facilities that are usually found inside the station. Now JR East is expanding on that concept, developing the viaducts beneath the Chuo Line in a project they are calling the "Chuo Line Mall." Utilizing the 70,000 square meters of open space beneath the railway, 5 stations are working to develop new shops and facilities that will greatly benefit the community. See how JR East's "Ekinaka" development strategy is bringing the towns and stations closer together.
episodes.description: 5 Chuo Line stations are currently developing the viaducts beneath the railway, bringing the towns and stations together with new shops and facilities. See JR East's "Ekinaka" development strategy.
episodes.subtitle: JR's Ekinaka Development Project: A New Lifestyle Below the Chuo Line
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: JR Central's long-awaited next-generation Shinkansen; the N700S is scheduled to begin operation in summer 2020. The new N700S makes use of state-of-the-art technology to enhance safety, convenience, and comfort. Changes include the addition of lithium-ion batteries, used to power an emergency self-propulsion system, and a fully active vibration control system, installed to improve the comfort of the ride. Join us as we look at how the Shinkansen has evolved over the years and get a sneak peek of this supreme new train.
episodes.description: JR Central's next-generation Shinkansen; the N700S is scheduled to start operation in summer 2020. Get a sneak peek of the new technologies employed to enhance safety, convenience, and comfort.
episodes.subtitle: Introducing the N700S: JR Central's Next-Generation Shinkansen
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: Railway companies in Japan are shifting toward the use of artificial intelligence and IoT systems to improve services. Responding to the increasing number of retiring railway employees and support staff, Japanese railways are finding new ways to operate, using state-of-the-art technology such as the Yamanote Line's one-button automatic train operation. Join us at "Mass-Trans Innovation Japan 2019" to see what new technologies are being utilized in the ever-evolving railway industry.
episodes.description: Japanese railways are shifting toward the use of artificial intelligence and IoT systems to improve services. Join us at "Mass-Trans Innovation Japan" to see what lies ahead for the future of railway.
episodes.subtitle: New Technology Opening the Future of the Railway
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: Once an icon in Japan, sleeper trains (commonly known as "blue trains") disappeared in the wake of faster and more convenient modes of transport. Sunrise Seto and Sunrise Izumo are now the only sleeper trains still in regular service. The Sunrise trains consist of private rooms and semi-private, partitioned "nobi-nobi" rooms for passengers on a budget. Join us as we journey overnight to see their charm, and find out why they are gaining popularity once again. Also on the show is a special guest, Donna Burke, the English voice of the Shinkansen!
episodes.description: Sunrise Seto and Izumo are the last sleeper trains still in regular service in Japan. Join us as we journey overnight to see their charm, and find out why they are gaining popularity once again.
episodes.subtitle: Sunrise Seto and Izumo: The Last of the Overnight Sleeper Trains
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: Echigo Tokimeki Railway in Niigata Prefecture started service in 2015, coinciding with the opening of the Hokuriku Shinkansen. However, due to a drop in passenger numbers, the company is currently 490 million yen in debt. The railway's hopes now rest with a new president, Akira Torizuka, who was appointed in September 2019. See how the president plans to revive the railway with exciting ideas that will benefit everyone.
episodes.description: Echigo Tokimeki Railway appointed a new president, bringing exciting new ideas to the third sector company. See how the president plans to revive the railway to benefit everyone.
episodes.subtitle: Echigo Tokimeki Railway: A Railway for Everyone
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: Visitors from around the world are expected to enter Japan through Tokyo's 2 international airports. JR East's "Narita Express" and Keisei Electric Railway's "Skyliner" service Narita Airport, while Keikyu Corporation and Tokyo Monorail service Haneda Airport. See how the railways are working to attract passengers by updating services, improving convenience and offering special discounts.
episodes.description: With the Tokyo 2020's big events on the way, railway companies are preparing for an increase in overseas passengers by improving the convenience of services to and from Tokyo's airports.
episodes.subtitle: A Guide to Tokyo's Airport Access Lines
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: Kintetsu Railway (known as the "kingdom of limited express trains") introduced the new "Series 80000 Hinotori," which operates between Osaka and Nagoya in March 2020. With comfort in mind, see how Kintetsu Railway developed its luxurious new limited express train with reclining backshell seats, ample legroom and more, to compete with the high-speed Shinkansen.
episodes.description: Hinotori is Kintetsu Railway's new limited express train that runs between Osaka and Nagoya. Focusing on passenger comfort, see how the company developed the train to compete with the shinkansen.
episodes.subtitle: Kintetsu Railway's Hinotori: Challenging the Shinkansen with Comfort
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: JR West is developing new services in response to lifestyle changes brought about by the coronavirus pandemic. One service involves the idea of a "workcation." JR West is now experimenting with packages that enable people to travel, stay and work in rural areas away from their homes in the city. To improve tourism, JR West has introduced a new tourist train called "etSETOra." The high-speed cruiser "SEA SPICA" and the "TWILIGHT EXPRESS MIZUKAZE" will also resume operation. Join us as we discuss the future of the railway post-pandemic with JR West's president, Mr. Hasegawa Kazuaki.
episodes.description: JR West is developing new services in response to lifestyle changes brought about by the coronavirus. We talk to the president of JR West about the future of the railway post-pandemic.
episodes.subtitle: JR West: Redefining the Role of the Railway Post Pandemic
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: The 67.7km Tenryu Hamanako Railroad in Shizuoka Prefecture is a third sector railway that connects 5 cities and 1 town. The railway is famous for its railway heritage, remnants of which can be found along the line, such as a turntable and roundhouse, old station buildings and bridges, 36 of which are registered tangible cultural property of Japan. This year marks the railway's 80th anniversary, but the coronavirus pandemic has seen ridership decline. See how Tenryu Hamanako Railroad is working with the local community to revitalize the area and make a comeback.
episodes.description: Tenryu Hamanako Railroad is famous for its turntable and old station buildings, but the pandemic has seen ridership decline. See how the railway is making a comeback with the local community.
episodes.subtitle: Tenryu Hamanako Railroad: Working with the Community to Revitalize the Railway
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: Many new express, commuter and tourist trains, as well as a sleeper train, began service in 2020. See the latest express trains, including the Tokaido Shinkansen "N700S," Kintetsu Railway's "HINOTORI" and JR East's luxurious "SAPHIR ODORIKO." Also, see the tourist train "etSETOra," which operates in the Setouchi region, and JR Kyushu's richly designed "36 Plus 3." In addition, see the "WEST EXPRESS GINGA," the first new sleeper train to be introduced in 21 years. Join us as we take a look back at Japan's latest trains and trends.
episodes.description: In 2020, many new express, commuter, and tourist trains, as well as a sleeper train, made their debut in 2020. Join us as we review Japan's latest trains and trends.
episodes.subtitle: Reviewing the New Trains of 2020
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal

episodes.content: The coronavirus pandemic has changed the way people live and work. While many people are now working from home, many others are still commuting to work. Because of this, several companies have begun working on solutions to reduce crowding during rush hours. Keio Corporation and Tobu Railway have both begun working on reservation systems, while JR East has developed an app to check train congestion. Train companies are also considering changing fares during peak and off-peak times to ensure passenger safety and peace of mind in these challenging times.
episodes.description: From reserved seats to dedicated apps, railway companies are developing ways to avoid busy commuter trains during the pandemic. See how they are working to ensure passenger safety and peace of mind.
episodes.subtitle: Keeping Commuters Safe during the Pandemic
episodes.title: Japan Railway Journal
